> [zeronetanon4](#comment_39_1LT3fcyEShsU9E1H5wiBceWmEpU6LcK7v): Its pretty impressive you were able to make something like that relatively quickly.  I started programming ~18 months ago with Python, I have a rough idea how you made some of it work.

It's a shitty quickly hacked together Python script that uses Selenium WebDriver to interact with the ZeroNet WebUI.
It opens up a slave Firefox browser, deletes the user identification files, runs a new ZeroNet instance, connects to 08chan, posts a thread, closes ZeroNet and does everything all over again on a loop.
Now you open this shit 7 times on different WebUI ports and you have seven Firefox windows spamming ZeroNet with useless shit.
Easy as fuck, anyone can do it.
I tried to "reverse engineer" the chan's engine first to create new posts, but using Selenium was easier.

> [btfo](#comment_3_1CJskzeMQsk8eHw8m4ZaF6bMhwxbPCwhNX): [...]

Of course you can break captcha and use proxies... if you pay for it.
Have you tried using free proxies for anything on 4chan? Captcha breaks because the proxy can't reach Google's servers, 4chan bans you instantly and it's slow as fuck.
Like I said in 08chan, it's not just a macro because the script also does filesystem operations and controls multiple ZeroNet instances running, opening and closing in the background.
And about the reverse engineering thing, that's why I put quotation marks in it, reverse engineering is not actual RE, it's just reading the code to see how it works, I was just too lazy to not do it so I used Selenium. If I had read it, though, I could just edit the user data and content JSON files and use ZeroNet to do a sitePublish on everything, it would be a lot faster and wouldn't need open Firefox instances.

> [qf2ss4t5y3365](#comment_12_1Nvii56FXr3CYjLPscUya4UutDqnMKjK1B):  [...]

IDs limit the flexibility of shills, but it also limits legit users who want to stay as anonymous as possible.
Security is almost always a double edged sword, you just have to balance the consequences.

> [btfo](#comment_5_1CJskzeMQsk8eHw8m4ZaF6bMhwxbPCwhNX):  [...]

Yeah, that's what I was saying, you have to pay for it, then it's doable.
People don't seem to want to pay for it that often, though, else we would have spam every day on 4chan.
And the macro thing is just nomenclature autism. If you don't want to use Firefox you can write your own Millchan content and data JSON generator and use ZeroNet-cli's sitePublish to manually publish it. It will still be kinda slow, since you have to wait for ZeroChan to generate a new certificate and push your changes to 5 peers (maybe 1 is enough? I don't know), but you can do what I did with Selenium and just open multiple instances or use multiprocessing to parallelize the script.
